metadata.Title: CVE-2022-27672 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
When SMT is enabled, certain AMD processors may speculatively executeinstructions using a target from the sibling thread after an SMT modeswitch potentially resulting in information disclosure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-27672` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-218-generic - 4.15.0-218.229
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-218-generic - 4.15.0-218.229
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-218-lowlatency - 4.15.0-218.229
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-156-generic - 5.4.0-156.173~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-156-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-156.173~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-156-lowlatency - 5.4.0-156.173~18.04.1

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-218.229').
